result.execSummary:
The defendant Humberto Lopez Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: EACH OTHER; AS TO BOTH COUNTS

CONCURRENT; AS TO EACH COUNT
Probation Review Hearing scheduled for 01/08/2016 @ 1:15pm, Br-38

miscConds.notes: AS TO BOTH COUNTS: Provide a DNA sample; pay DNA surcharge. Pay all mandatory costs, assessments, surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by the DOC's. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION AS TO BOTH COUNTS:
- Attend and successfully complete Batterers Intervention OR Anger Management and continued programming.
- AODA and recommended treatment including random urine screens/Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
- Parenting classes.
- Attend and successfully complete treatment and counseling programs as deemed appropriate by agent.
- Follow all Children's Court orders and orders of Bureau of Milwaukee Child Welfare.
- NO VIOLENT CONTACT with the victim or child(ren) risinig to the level of probable cause for arrest.
- Obtain/maintain employment.
- NO NEW LAW VIOLATIONS.

timeConds.notes: Consecutive as to Each Count; STAYED pending a review on 01-08-169 at 1:15pm, Br-38

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Humberto Lopez Jr

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Defendant Humberto Lopez in court.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.

Defendant Humberto Lopez in court with attorney Daniel E Meylink.  Abbey Marie DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law.  
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by parties and the defendant.
AS TO EACH COUNT: 
The court sentenced the defendant to serve 6 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to one another, with credit for 1 day time served as to count 1. 
The court STAYED sentences and placed defendant on probation with the WI Department of Corrections for a period of 18 months, concurrent.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-Serve 30 days in the House of Correction, conseutive STAYED pending a review on 1-8-2016 at 1:15pm in Branch 38.
-Attend and successfully complete Batterers Intervention OR Anger Management and continued programming.
-AODA and recommended treatment including random urine screens/Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
-Parenting classes.
-Attend and successfully complete treatment and counseling programs as deemed appropriate by agent.
Follow all Childrens Court orders and orders of Bureau of Milwaukee Child Welfare.
-NO VIOLENT CONTACT with the victim or child(ren) rising to the level of probable cause for arrest 
-Obtain/maintain employment.
-No contact with firearms.
-NO NEW LAW VIOLATIONS.
-Pay all MANDATORY costs, assessments, surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by Dept of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. ANY CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO BE APPLIED.
-Provide DNA sample, pay costs and DNA surcharge.
RECEIVED & FILED: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief; Pretrial Incarceration Credit; Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for January 8, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 2
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements, received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Case adjourned to branch 38 for Sentencing.

Defendant Humberto Lopez in court with attorney Daniel E Meylink.  Molly Schmidt appeared on behalf of Abbey Marie DeSiato for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Court VACATED stayed warrant. Parties have reached a resolution.

AS TO COUNT 1
Pursuant to plea negotiations, on motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended to Battery, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s)940.19(1) and 939.51(3)(a), a Class A Misdemeanor.

AS TO COUNT 2
Pursuant to plea negotiations, on motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended to Battery, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s)940.19(1) and 939.51(3)(a), a Class A Misdemeanor.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 25, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Attorney Daniel E Meylink in court.  Abbey Marie DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Defense placed reasons on the record as to defendant's whereabouts. Court stayed a bench warrant until the next court date. Case adjourned for a Plea Hearing in branch 38.  Plea hearing scheduled for August 14, 2015 at 08:15 am.

CASE SET IN ERROR ON AUGUST 7, 2015, BRANCH 38 WILL NOT BE IN SESSION.
Clerk contacted parties and case is re-set to August 11 2015 at 8:15 for plea.
Defendant to be present.

Defendant Humberto Lopez in court with attorney Daniel E Meylink.  Dax Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Pretrial Conference held off the record.  Defense counsel has received discovery and offer.  Case is adjourned for Plea Hearing in Branch 4 on 8-7-2015 at 1:30 pm.   mld
Court amended the no contact order to no violent contact or physicial discipline of child HL (d.o.b. 7-5-2008), or any child.   mld

Defendant Humberto Lopez in court with attorney Daniel E Meylink.  Abbey Marie DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Discovery received by defense counsel.  Court heard and granted the Motion of the State and defense who joined motion, that the no contact order is amended to no violent contact or physicial discipline of child HL (d.o.b. 7-5-2008), or any child and no violations of the law.  Case adjourned for Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 6-16-2015 at 1:30 pm.   mld
Preliminary hearing on May 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order. Defendant to have no contact with HL (d.o.b. 07-05-2008) to be monitored by the Bureau of Milwaukee Child Welfare.

Defendant Humberto Lopez in court with attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 4. Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION. Case is adjourned for a Preliminary Hearing in Branch 40.    DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 3:00 P.M. ON  (05-14-2015). IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 5/13/15 @ 1:30pm
